form.Steps:
1. Lie on a bench and have a partner place a board on your chest. Alternatively, secure it with a band on the barbell. 
2. Grip the barbell at your desired width and unrack the weight. 
3. Lower the bar until it touches the board, and make sure to keep the tension in your upper body to maintain position. 
4. Press the barbell back up to the starting position in a controlled, explosive movement.

tempo: 2010. Why? The board press emphasizes the top half of the bench press movement. A controlled eccentric is still important, and the brief pause at the top helps reinforce lockout strength.
alternativesAndVariations: Bench press and all its variations
